sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Safe Bottled Water Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Safe Bottled Water Act.

sections.heading: Water intended for bottling; storage, transportation, and processing.
sections.text: Water intended for bottling; storage, transportation, and processing.

sections.heading: License fee.  The fee for any license issued under this Act is
sections.text:
$150. The
fee must be paid to the Department before a license may be issued. Licenses issued under this Act shall be issued annually. Licenses must be renewed annually on or before January 1 of the year for which they are issued. The Department may impose an additional fee of $50 on a person who submits an application for a license after the deadline. The Department shall use all fees received under this Act for the purpose of recouping the costs of providing the services required to be provided by the Department under this Act.

sections.heading: Water-bottling plants located outside Illinois
sections.text: Every water-bottling plant located outside Illinois that sells or distributes bottled water in Illinois must annually register with the Department. The fee for registration under this Act is $150. The Department may impose an additional fee of $50

sections.heading: Safe Bottled Water Fund. The Safe Bottled Water
sections.text:
Fund is established as a special fund in the State treasury. All moneys
received
by the Department under this Act shall be deposited into the fund. Moneys in
the fund
shall be used by the Department,
upon appropriation, for the purpose of administering this Act.

sections.heading: Denial, revocation, or suspension of license.
sections.text: Denial, revocation, or suspension of license.

sections.heading: Testing laboratories.  All testing of bottled water, bottled
sections.text:
water sources,
water distributed by water haulers, water from retail water facilities,
and water from vending machines must be done by competent laboratories
approved by the Department or another state's regulatory agency.

sections.heading: Water packaged for use in public emergencies.
sections.text: Water packaged for use in public emergencies.

sections.heading: Violation; penalty.  A person who commits a violation of this Act other than a violation of subsection (c) of Section 15 is guilty of a petty offense and subject to a fine of not more than $1,000
sections.text: Violation; penalty. A person who commits a violation of this Act other than a violation of subsection (c) of Section 15 is guilty of a petty offense and subject to a fine of not more than $1,000.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2005.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2005.
